intro: Oldenlandia aparine, commonly known as stickyweed, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers and its distinctive, sticky hairs on the stems and leaves. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a rough texture due to the presence of trichomes. Oldenlandia aparine is known for its ability to thrive in humid environments and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
